intro: Ehretia seyrigii, commonly known as the Sierra Madre mahogany, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
